title: Senior citizen among 3 women held for stealing
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 2
Three women, including a senior citizen, were arrested after they managed to steal a gold bangle from complainant Santosh Rani, while boarding a bus at Matka Chowk. The police claim that the women are suspected to be members of a gang that rob pedestrians after offering them lift. The police said, Santosh Rani, a resident of Sector 4, Panchkula, complained that the women identified as Krishna (60), a resident of Amritsar, Charanjit Kaur a resident of Dhuri, Sangrur district and Jaswant Kaur of Kokra village, Patiala district, stole her bangle by cutting it while boarding the bus. The victim came to know about the incident and raised an alarm. The police arrived at the spot and arrested the accused. “The accused smartly cut the bangles and steal them and the victim doesn’t even get to know about that”, said a police official. A case under Sections 356 (assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of a property carried by a person), 379 (theft), 411 (dishonestly receiving stolen property) and 34(acts done by several person in furtherance of common intention) of the Indian Penal Code has been registered against the accused at the Sector 3 police station. The women were presented in the court and sent on three-day police remand. The police said similar incidents of thefts were reported in Sector 28 and Mani Majra.
